comment: Straightforward directions and clear organization. Not the most warm professor, but has great handwriting, color codes as she teaches, is very straightforward about what you NEED to know. Provides packets to print out to follow along during class. Quiz every other week, in class participation problems, 4 tests, midterm and final with study guides
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Attendance isn't required, with caveats. There are classwork grades that can only be completed in class, but they count for very small portions of your final grade. Dr. Bhat teaches calculus by the book. She's very good about providing resources, but her ability to answer pressing questions from the bottom up is rather... limited.

Dr.B is the BEST calculus professor you can take at Kennesaw. She's very sweet and caring. Her lectures never felt long, her exams were very easy (some multiple choice questions) and she is easy to understand. If you listen to any rate my professor reviews listen to this one. This is my 3rd time taking calculus and I wish I took her sooner!

She cares so much about her students, easy to ask questions to, easy to find outside of class, answers email. Three "midterms", quizzes every other week, and online homework every week. quizzes are easier than hw. drops alot of quizzes/homework grades. Lectures easy to understand. she provides fill in note pages.

Gives you outline for notes, 2 homework on alek weekly, 1 two question quiz a week, and 2 question worksheets occasionally. Not a bad teacher, but I had a hard time grasping her lectures (I had to go to tutoring before every test). Tests pretty easy (one question for each type of problem). Drops a ton of hw quizzes and class work which def helps.

Test and quizzes are not very hard. There is a good amount of homework but HW is harder than the quizzes. Lectures are not hard to follow but a little slow. You're free to ask questions in class but she can get annoyed if people keep asking questions from past units
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof. Bhat was a great professor and made Calculus quite smooth. This course is graded by a variety of things including attendance, online HW (Achieve), quizzes, and tests (final replaces lowest). Her teaching, while from notes, is intuitive and makes understanding the concepts simple. Very helpful - she cares about all of her students.

Good teacher that made sure the entire class could understand the material. The hw is usually a lot harder than the tests but the practice exams are similar to the actual exam. I think the people that wrote bad reviews were just too slow.

By far my fav teacher. she has no accent at all which is a plus for me. class is test heavy, but notes are fill and posted after every class. 4 mid terms and a final is majority of what makes up your grade, but she gives you 3 practice exams that resemble the 3 versions of the test. she learns students names and answers emails quickly typically.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Nothing else matters but the test in this class they are 70% of your grade, outside of the of that students are bombarded with weekly quizzes and hours of busy work disguised as homework take anyone else if you can you have been warned!!! 100% the worst professor I've had be prepared to teach yourself/ get taught by a tutor this teacher is useless.
Very bad teaching.

Dr. B is a pretty great professor, but she doesn't give that many examples for new concepts. She goes into very meticulous detail on how to solve each problem, which makes learning quire easy (and her handwriting is amazing). 

The homework absolutely sucks because it doesn't give good feedback and it's 2 sections with 14-24 questions per section.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: She seems nice at first, but do not let that fool you. I asked a question about the test and she went off on me. I don't recommend taking her ever. lots of homework. exams have nothing to do with homework study guide or anything so beware. ALSO she will NOT allow you to use a calculator in a CALCULUS class.

Dr. Ashwini Bhat is an incredible professor! In her class, you comprehend the concepts differently because she explains them as is. She does not over complicate theories, which makes Calculus II so much more manageable. Participation in her class was extremely beneficial towards my grade. I passed Calculus II with an A with Dr. Ashwini Bhat.

This is calc 2, it is NOT an easy class, however, this easily was the best professor I could have ever chosen for the class. If you want to stay on Kennesaw campus, TAKE HER. Go to lectures, do her practice tests, and use the notes she gives you, and you WILL get the grade you want to get.

She's very joyful and enthusiastic about math. Her quizzes can be hit or miss since they're only two questions; however, she drops half of them. She drops a lot of homework grades as well. She also gives plenty of practice exams to study from. Easy to get a good grade when you put in the effort.

Amazing professor. She was really clear in her communication during lectures and even would make fill-in notes for us. She made all her students feel comfortable asking questions. She would also color-code her notes, so you knew what was going on. Very energetic in class. Highly recommend!!

Dr. Bhat is seriously the best math professor I've ever had. Her lectures are step-by-step, she never makes you feel bad for asking questions, even about pre-req math concepts, and she is very lenient in grading. She drops 4 quiz grades, 7 homework grades, and has office hours almost every day on alternating campuses. So sweet and patient.

Dr. Bhat is the reason I could to pass calc II. Her lectures were step by step, even going back to recap prerequisite topics if she felt like the class was confused. I got a 0 on the prerequisite quiz (took calc I 1.5 years ago) but she drops half of them and her teaching is so good that I still passed with an A. Go to her lectures, she's the best.

Professor Bhat was a great Professor. This was my second time taking Calc 2 and it clicked with her. She was caring and helped me understand the topics. When students had questions she would stop and help them; she wanted everyone to understand the material.

Rate my professor is not always correct, such as I this case. Fantastic teacher and gives every opportunity to be successful. Show up to every lecture for class points and put in the work for it and she will always reciprocate the effort. Easy to access outside of class and explains difficult topics better than anyone else I can imagine. Take her!!

Dr. Bhat is an awesome teacher who gives incredible lectures, clear grading guidelines, and great communication. Grading is broken down like so; (1) class points = 5%,  (2) homework = 25%, (3) quizzes = 5%, (4) midterm exams = 45% (15% each), and (5) final exam = 20%. Scores on 1 - 4 will be dropped and 5 will replace your lowest midterm grade.

I don't see where these bad reviews come from. On day one, she makes everything clear about how she's grading and when quizzes/tests are given out. She drops 4 quizzes and the final exam can replace a lower exam grade. There is a calendar with every quiz/test date as well as homework. How are you going to learn to do math without showing up???

I don't know where all the horrible ratings come from lmao. She gives you everything you need to know on day one. 4 Lowest quizzes dropped and the final exam will replace one of your lower exam grades (really generous). The homework is maybe like 10-15 questions a week, and she goes through everything slowly and answers questions in class.

Dr. B is a great professor if you want to do well in her course. She is always there to help. She always posts notes online and gives you guided notes to print out for class. She always gives feedback on tests and quizzes that is easy to understand. Sometimes she allows retakes for a test, and she always allows retakes for quizzes.

Very caring and great prof! There is a lot of work to complete, but her lecture notes as well as the study guides helped immensely. You must attend class or it will hurt you! You were able to retake quizzes for a higher grade w/ the same questions. Her study guide questions are exactly like the exams, so I rec completing the study guide ahead!!

Dr. B did a wonderful job of going in depth with the content and clearly outlining all the steps to get to the answer, even down to things like factoring and combining like terms. She was very reliable when I needed to get help with the exam review. Overall, terrific teacher and I would highly recommend, especially to those interested in calculus.

Dr. B is a great professor. She drops a lot of grades and gives extra credit. Exams are 65% of your grade, but she gives study guides which are very similar to the exams and help a lot. Homework is manageable and helpful in preparing for the exams. I recommend taking her.

Good teacher, goes through everything step by step, willing to answer questions, and available outside of class. Textbook is online and free. Homework is really helpful when preparing for tests and quizzes, especially since it's actually way harder than anything on the test. Took both MATH 1190 and MATH 2202. Did well in both. Definitely recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Bhat was an amazing professor. She was always ready to help her students with whatever was needed. I would struggle with some of the concepts, but Dr. Bhat was just an email away to help me figure out how the different concepts worked.
Just don't take the class!!!!!!!!!!
70% are Tests. The study guide doesn't help at all. She does not scan her notes. If you miss a class or don't pay attention you will miss the concept.

Dr Bhat is the best math teachers I have ever had, without her I would have failed Calc 2. She offers retakes on quizzes, lots of extra credit, study sessions, and lenient deadlines on homework. Would take her class again.

Dr. Bhat is one of the most thoughtful math teachers I have ever had the chance to be taught by. She offers multiple extra credit opportunities throughout the year, uploads multiple practice assignments per test, and will answer back any questions you email her with. Take her for calc 2 if you have the chance!!

I took Calculus 1 with her and she wasn't helpful at all. She had no good lecture videos, hw every other day. There was no extra credit either, it was like she didn't want her students to pass. Made the class as difficult as possible. She took 2-3 days to respond the email. I recommend signing up for Katie Cristensen for any math courses at KSU.
Exams were 70% of the final grade, in person, on paper, no calculator unless scientific. Including the final, there a FOUR exams... I only took her class because it fit my schedual.

If I could give her a 0/5 I would. This is probably the worst teacher I have EVER taken. If you want to submit assignments on THREE different grading services then this is the teacher for you. If you want to be confused constantly and given absolutely no assistance in improving your grade then this is the teacher for you! Please NEVER take her!!!
No. Just no. Dont do it to yoursef
Her lectures are not helpful, she has homework due every 2 days, NO EXTRA CREDIT. Overall a she makes the class hard to pass.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I have never had a worse experience with a professor. In a math class where problems needs to be explained, she doesnt make time to explain them. And when I ask for her to go over a problem, she tells me to wait for another class because it will mess up the flow of this one. Her exams are ridiculously hard and her homework is absurd.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: You think these people are exaggerating when they say this is the worst professor they have taken. Yea I thought so too and they not lying. she tests like Im trying to get a freaking doctorate in mathematics. Fairly easy questions in class but tests are as if Im studying rocket science. Save yourself and go in class. At least youll pass.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Do you want to almost fail a class? Easy. Go ahead and take this class. She will murder your GPA as if it didn't matter. She has been by far the worst professor I have had. Yeah, the teachers' pets are obviously saying she's a good teacher and all, but they aren't showing her side that makes every test or quiz a complete nightmare. Just beware!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Bhat was one of the worst teachers I have ever taken. If you don't do well in math DO NOT TAKE HER. The material covered in class is nowhere close to the material on the exams. Lots of homework but it's bearable. Her exams are proctored. Please don't take her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I found Professor Bhat very sweet and agreeable. This is the second time I have taken this class and it was difficult, however I wouldn't expect Calc 1 to be any different. She is very helpful and uses good examples in class that show up on tests later. She isn't an easy A, however she is not a bad professor and deserves a much higher rating.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: Despite what the other comments say, I think she was kind and taught well. She explained each step (like most math teachers). There is a bit of homework, but examples help you learn. The numbers on the test are simple enough to do without a calculator. The only thing I didn't like was ProctorU. She is passionate about math and wants to help you.

I beg you and I warn you DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. Unless you're a mathematician or super smart you will not PASS. The lectures are torture because they are so long and boring. The EXAMS is extremely hard I have not gotten a 60 on one test. Lots of homework and quizzes that hardly help on the tests! This is by far the worst teacher I have ever had.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Im at kennesaw with an academic full ride after receiving a 4.0 in high school. Nothing I have done has been this difficult, and it feels difficult for zero reason at that. The homework and lecture quizzes are very doable, but come test time and the material takes a huge jump. Shown work is mandatory, and test are creepily 3rd party proctored.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Test are 10x harder than the review. Seems nice at first but dont be fooled. If you have the choice of picking a different calc professor you should. Fighting for my life in this class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS OR ANY CLASS WITH THIS TEACHER!!! This is the worst teacher Ive ever had!! What she teaches is different from the test. You do not get to use a calculator at all. Theres no formula sheet. The practice exams are not like the test. Just go ahead and look for another teacher! Shes a whole graduate student at that.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: This teacher so far is the worst one I've encountered at KSU. She has no respect for her students and she teaches us all as if we've already taken calculus. Please, for the love of your GPA, DON'T TAKE HER CLASS!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: BEWARE!!!! THIS IS YOUR WARNING... DO NOT TAKE HER!! Terrible professor with a horrible attitude. Not allowed to use a calculator and she's just a terrible teacher in general. She expects you to know everything before entering her class. Had to drop her class ASAP.

TRUST ME. This is the worst math professor you will every take. She takes an hour 40 minutes to go through 5 simple problems in class and then give problems 10x the difficulty on the test. Homework is manageable. Live proctors watch testing. She seems like a nice person but I'm not sure who gave her 5 stars. they are lying. Spare yourself

Professor Bhat isnt as terrible as people make her out to be, but passing this class for me at least was almost impossible. 3 exams with only 13 questions and what we were taught in class didnt really match up with whats on the exams. Also, you were being watched and recorded live for all the exams. Homework was also difficult.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The WORST professor ever!! Tests are very difficult and her attitude is also awful!! STAY AWAY FROM THIS PROFESSOR!!!

She has very hard tests and tons of Hw. Her in class problems are usually fairly easy but the Hw and tests are much harder. She also expects you to remember all previous math from 7th-trig and will not refresh us on unit circles or certain formulas. However she does explain simple things such as what an odd number is, or what "decreasing" means.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: DO NOT TAKE. I am in her class right now and I hate her class so much. She has the worse attitude and teaching skills of all time. I have never had a professor that I hated this much. I am warning everyone: DO NOT TAKE HER WHATSOEVER.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Bhat is a great professor whose lectures were easy to follow and gave plenty of examples. Took her class asynchronously during fall 2020. No calculators are allowed but the tests were made so they test your calculus knowledge. lots of homework but it is manageable. GO TO OFFICE HOURS, she is very willing to help with the class or just talk.

This teacher was a nightmare. Yeah, she may seem nice and all but definitely the worst professor I have ever had. She has the worst attitude when you think something isn't right and doesn't let you use a calculator for the tests when everything in CALCULUS NEEDS A CALCULATOR. I'm still in her class but depending on how this next test goes, IDK.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Took her fall 2020 during a whole pandemic and she had no remorse. KSU stuck me in her class instead of the one I chose. Her lectures are horrible. The homework is nothing like the lecture, the study guides are nothing like the hw or lecture, and the tests are nothing like the study guides, hw, or lecture. She seems nice but don't let her fool you.
